intro: Hebenstretia capitata, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, daisy-like flower heads in shades of yellow and orange. The flowers are borne on long, slender stems and are arranged in dense clusters at the top of the plant. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
